title: Input Systems
overview: Build reliable, responsive controls by treating input as state.
objectives: Differentiate between Input Events and Input State

sections.title: State vs Events
sections.content:
**Bad**: Reacting directly to `keydown` events (causes repeat delay).

**Good**: Tracking key state in an object:
```js
const keys = {};
window.addEventListener('keydown', e => keys[e.key] = true);
```
Thus, you can check `if (keys['ArrowRight'])` inside your update loop.

questions.question: Why is tracking key state better than events for movement?
options: It avoids the operating system's key-repeat delay
It is supported by more browsers
questions.correctAnswer: It avoids the operating system's key-repeat delay
questions.explanation: Events trigger once, then wait, then repeat. Games need continuous checks every frame.

questions.question: How does input state help multiplayer?
options: You can send the state (inputs) to the server every tick
questions.correctAnswer: You can send the state (inputs) to the server every tick
